readability_reflection: I believe concatenation to be more readable as I've had more practice with it. I don't remember specific examples but say when reading "x = {x}" vs "x = " + x, I would be able to read the ladder better but the first is very easy to read.
comprehension_debugging: Learning these helps me read syntax a bit more. I believe there is an advantage to reading messy code or just lengthy coding in general.
preference_rationale: I think long-term I would prefer interpolation because it would be faster to code using it. It made the code look cleaner and less lines so in my head I feel like it would be faster.
learning_curve: I think learning these skills lets me recognize the pattern to the code examples. Working with strings in past CS classes has helped me understand these snippets.
suggestions_improvement: Interpolation being used in conjunction with concatenation can cause the original concatenated code to be neater.
